chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew C. Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety.
Shall not have access to internet or electronic devices with WIFI capabilities without agent approval.
Shall not have contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.
GFE to maintain fulltime work/fulltime school or a combination.

Register as Sex offender for 15 years
Assessments, counseling, and treatment as recommended by agent.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is ummarily affirmed.  Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Angela Henderson is relieved of her obligation to further represent Burks in this matter. Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

Case Called: 10:24 am
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer and ADA Molly Lawrence; Deft appears in custody and with Atty Brian Bennett.
Date and time set for an Argued Sentencing Hearing.
Atty Bennett makes statement regarding the corrections to be made on the PSI.
State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement.
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (Child Enticement-Sexual Contact-Attempt)>> 10 WSPS, 5 IC and 5 ES, concurrent. ES CONDITIONS: Maintain Absolute sobriety, Assessments/Counseling/Treatment as recommended by agent, Pay all Court Costs and obligations including a DNA Sample, Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Shall not have access to Internet or electronic devices with WIFI capabilities without agent approval, Shall not have contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent, Defendant to register with the Sex Offender Registry for 15 years.  COURT finds 300 days jail credit. Not eligible for programming.

Ct. 2 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>> 3 WSPS, 1 IC and 2 ES, concurrent. ES CONDITIONS: Maintain Absolute sobriety, Assessments/Counseling/Treatment as recommended by agent, Pay all Court Costs and obligations including a DNA Sample, Good faith effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Shall not have access to Internet or electronic devices with WIFI capabilities without agent approval, Shall not have contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent, Defendant to register with the Sex Offender Registry for 15 years.  COURT finds 300 days jail credit. Not eligible for programming.

REMANDED TO THE CUSTODY OF MARATHON CO. SHERIFFS DEPARTMENT.

Case Called: 10:45am. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA's Lisa Gramer & Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Brian Bennett. Matter set for Final Pretrial - parties have agreement.  State files Amended Information with Court. OTR 10:49am. BOTR @ 10:53am.  Parties ready to proceed with Plea. W/R of Amended Information. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to amend ct 1 (use a computerto faciltate child sex crime) to 1 ct of attempt child enticement (948.07(1); (939.50(3)(d) - crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 3 (poss drug para) - crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - amend ct1 (attempt child enticement); ct 2 (poss meth). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  COURT ORDERS PSI. Bond to Continue. State recites partial agreement to sentencing pursuant to PSI. Crt advises and defendant signs Voting Form. DATES: Sentencing- 8/7/10am - 1 1/2 hrs.  Adjourned: 11:02am.

Absolute sobriety.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report.   No contact with victim(s):  children under 18 years of age.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No computers or Internet use.
